channel.description: The top News headlines from The Sydney Morning Herald. For all the news, visit https://www.smh.com.au
channel.title: Sydney Morning Herald - Latest News

item.description: There has been a long-running war of words between British and Portuguese authorities about the handling of the McCann case, particularly over the woeful preservation of the crime scene and Madeleine's parents being incorrectly named as suspects.
item.title: UK police 'ignored' Madeleine McCann suspect for years

item.dc:creator: Max Koslowski
item.description: Finance Minister Mathias Cormann said protesters were "selfish" and "quite irresponsible" for ignoring health advice when other gatherings such as funerals have been curbed.
item.title: Minister says Black Lives Matter protesters 'incredibly selfish'

item.description: Haydn, Bach and Beethoven were on the menu for a musical feast served as overture, concerto and symphony.
item.title: Digital concert delivers food for the soul

item.dc:creator: Ellen Connolly
item.description: If you suspect you or a family member has coronavirus you should call (not visit) your GP or ring the national Coronavirus Health Information Hotline on 1800 020 080.
item.title: Coronavirus updates LIVE: Global COVID-19 cases surpass 6.7 million as Australian death toll stands at 102

item.dc:creator: Ashleigh McMillan
item.description: Victoria's health authorities are 'quietly hopeful' about suppressing COVID-19, but it will be a week-long wait to see how protests affect the tally.
item.title: Four new Victorian COVID-19 cases but no new community transmission

item.dc:creator: Warwick Green
item.description: He describes himself as a "hard-arse", but working with Neale Daniher has shown me there's more to him than that. And he has one hint of regret about his coaching career.
item.title: The real Neale: Understanding the Daniher paradox

item.description: A staggering 18 per cent of participants confessed they'd applied cleaning agents to their skin.
item.title: Americans have gargled bleach, applied it to their skin, survey shows

item.description: In 1998, David Key of the Victorian Police's air wing became the designated Tea Bag aboard a rescue helicopter roaring towards Bass Strait and an unfolding disaster in the Sydney to Hobart Yacht Race.
item.title: From the Archives: Heroes of the 1998 Sydney to Hobart tell of yacht rescues

item.dc:creator: Peter Hannam
item.description: The man, believed to be aged in his sixties, had been surfing at the time of the bite.
item.title: Man dies after three-metre shark bites his leg off on northern NSW beach

item.description: Back in the old normal, as it shall now be named, handshakes and hugs were customary. Now, extending a palm is near criminal.
item.title: Your social etiquette guide to navigating the 'new normal'

item.description: The government has identified two cases in which humans had been infected by minks – the only animal-to-human transmissions known since the global outbreak began in China.
item.title: Dutch mink cull starts as coronavirus spreads to 10th farm

item.description: The letter calls the spread of "deliberate misinformation and divisive language" contrary to the researchers' work.
item.title: Zuckerberg-funded scientists call on Facebook to rein in Trump

item.dc:creator: Nathan Hondros
item.description: West Australians looking to build a new home will be given $20,000 by the state government on top of the Commonwealth's $25,000 HomeBuilder grant.
item.title: Helping hand for new home builders as WA set to expand apartment stamp duty discounts

item.dc:creator: Jocelyn Garcia
item.description: The two boys and two girls were killed when the stolen car they were in rolled early on Sunday.
item.title: 'Tragic beyond words': Four teenagers killed in Townsville car crash

item.description: Arsenal hosted second-tier side Charlton at the Emirates Stadium, while Manchester United and Chelsea staged games between their own players.
item.title: Premier League giants play practice games

item.description: A 19-month-old girl was killed on Saturday evening after she was run over in a driveway on Walter Road East.
item.title: Girl killed in tragic Bayswater driveway accident

item.dc:creator: Sally Rawsthorne
item.description: Jane Margaret was frightened for black protesters at Central Station, so she created a shield between them and police.
item.title: Woman on crutches says she was 'maced in the face', two others charged after Sydney protest

item.description: A lawyer acting for one of the police officers said his client is a decorated military veteran with a clean record as a police officer.
item.title: Two Buffalo police charged with assault over shoving of elderly protester

item.description: Leverkusen substitute Florian Wirtz has become the youngest goalscorer in Bundesliga history but his effort came in 4-2 loss to Bayern.
item.title: Teen makes Bundesliga history but Bayern march on toward title

item.dc:creator: Bevan Shields
item.description: Both sides are scrambling to thrash out a free trade deal to come into force once a Brexit transition period ends.
item.title: Fresh round of Brexit negotiations end with no progress as deadline looms

item.description: British Airways has warned it will sack all of its 4300 pilots if it can't reach an agreement with unions over further job cuts as the airline starts a legal push to block the UK government's 14-day self-isolation plan for arrivals starting on Monday.
item.title: British Airways threatens to fire pilots, fights UK quarantine rule

item.description: World No.1 Novak Djokovic says participating in the US Open would be impossible due to the "extreme" COVID-19 protocols in place for the tournament.
item.title: Impossible to play US Open under 'extreme' virus protocols: Djokovic

item.description: With a 3.2 per cent swing in its favour, the LNP now leads Labor 52 per cent to 48 per cent on a two-party-preferred basis.
item.title: Queensland Premier faces uphill battle at next election, according to poll

item.description: Manly coach Des Hasler has concerns about new laws eroding competitiveness in the NRL but a rival coach has a blunter theory.
item.title: Blowout scores exposing those who didn't work hard during shutdown: Maguire

item.description: Soon we will write "the history of our future as a post-COVID society", says the man once known as Perth's 'festival guy'. And we want a history to be proud of.
item.title: Making Perth civic life cool again: Thoughts from a pale, male and only slightly stale former councillor

item.dc:creator: Sally Rawsthorne
item.description: A five-year-old boy has died, and a man are missing after a boat capsized off the NSW coast near Wollongong.
item.title: Body of a five-year-old boy found, man missing, in accident off NSW coast

item.dc:creator: Ashleigh McMillan
item.description: A crime scene has been established after the house fire in Tyaak, about 100 kilometres north of Melbourne.
item.title: Two babies among 11 people injured in central Victorian house blaze, with two still missing

item.description: British boxer Anthony Joshua says "the virus has been declared a pandemic and is out of control. The virus I'm referring to is called racism."
item.title: As George Floyd is mourned, the world stops to say 'enough'

item.description: Follow our rolling coverage.
item.title: Tablet interactive: Coronavirus outbreak

item.dc:creator: Matt Wade
item.description: A blokey recovery doesn’t fit with what we know about the economic effects of the pandemic.
item.title: Scott Morrison is betting on a shovel-led recovery but the jobs bonanza is elsewhere

item.description: One Wednesday two weeks ago I got a mild sore throat. By Sunday I was in hospital.
item.title: Thank you Sydney, your lockdown sacrifices saved my life

item.description: Constant busyness and external accolades are so lauded in our world, the greatest challenge could well be to let them go during this enforced calmness.
item.title: Pandemic pause opens window to a more contemplative world

item.dc:creator: Linda Morris
item.description: The public will soon get to check out the firms and their designs for the controversial new precinct.
item.title: Powerhouse finalists revealed

item.dc:creator: The Herald's View
item.description: When COVID-19 tore through the economy, all the government could do was press massive wads of cash onto the wounds of suffering businesses. But you can’t hold those wounds closed forever.
item.title: Government must step away from the Band-Aids and look to the long term

item.dc:creator: Max Koslowski
item.description: Victoria Legal Aid's office is usually quiet around Christmas. But in 2016 the first calls from robo-debt victims came in. They turned into a flood.
item.title: 'They nearly cost me my life': How robo-debt turned lives upside down

item.dc:creator: Wendy Tuohy
item.description: Many people are reporting a negative impact of isolation on their relationship, but some are working it out.
item.title: Number of couples seeking separation advice soars during lockdown

item.dc:creator: Danny Weidler
item.description: Cronulla have been forced to make a huge payment to their former captain to avoid being sued for the 2011 peptides scandal.
item.title: Star's $700,000 payout: The story Paul Gallen didn't want you to read

item.dc:creator: Patrick Hatch
item.description: The federal government will continue to underwrite domestic flights operated by Qantas, Virgin and Regional Express between capital cities and regional destinations, even as airlines start to add capacity back into their networks in response to rising traveller demand.
item.title: Government to extend financial backing for domestic flights

item.dc:creator: Natassia Chrysanthos
item.description: For thousands of university students, online learning was not what they paid for. Motivation has dropped and many fear they haven't learnt content they need to progress their degrees.
item.title: Students fear lost semester of learning as universities plan for campus return

item.dc:creator: Adam Pengilly
item.description: A small group of former NRL players, some of whom had only just retired from the game, were found to have "widespread" white matter changes in the study.
item.title: Groundbreaking study finds significant brain changes in league players

item.dc:creator: Tony Moore
item.description: Shouts of Peace Now and Black Lives Matter echoed through central Brisbane as one of the largest rallies in the past decade showed support for forces opposing racism.
item.title: 'It can't just be the minority': Thousands raise their voices in Brisbane

item.dc:creator: Caitlin Fitzsimmons
item.description: The main roads out of Sydney were clogged with traffic as city dwellers took advantage of the easing of travel restrictions.
item.title: 'There's a real vibe': Sydneysiders flock to holiday towns for long weekend of freedom

item.dc:creator: Jennifer Duke
item.description: The industry is warning the government may need to give exemptions if banks and councils can't speed up loans and development approvals.
item.title: 'Free money': Real estate agents flooded with calls about HomeBuilder grant

item.dc:creator: Lucy Manly
item.description: An affair with a client has hair salon couple splitting.
item.title: Salon scandal rocks Double Bay

item.dc:creator: Jordan Baker
item.description: Weeks of remote schooling due to COVID-19 has given parents new insight into their children's learning.
item.title: 'A great opportunity': What COVID schooling taught parents about their kids

item.dc:creator: Kate Aubusson
item.description: NSW has weathered three weeks of relaxed COVID-19 restrictions with no sign of the much-feared second wave, but state health authorities say this is no time to congratulate ourselves on a job well done.
item.title: Good habits stave off second wave in NSW three weeks after restrictions relaxed

item.dc:creator: Peter Hannam
item.description: Marine ecosystems along a stretch of Sydney's coastline from the Hawkesbury River down to Botany Bay have been devastated by a 'chemical event'.
item.title: 'Mass mortality event' devastates Sydney's coastal ecosystems

item.dc:creator: Jacqueline Maley
item.description: Inquiries and expert reports keep telling us what to do about Indigenous disadvantage. We keep not doing it - and not listening to First Australians.
item.title: Why so defensive? The Australian ego is fragile on the question of racism

item.dc:creator: Robert Moran
item.description: What's a bunch of bad reviews to Netflix? Not much, it seems.
item.title: Space Force: Netflix's biggest bomb? Not so fast

item.dc:creator: Peter FitzSimons
item.description: Going to court to stop the Black Lives Matter rally while relaxing restrictions on the footy was confusing.
item.title: First she said yes, then she said no: Berejiklian could have handled clash of priorities better
